resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

worklogs.comment:
tianchen92 commented on pull request #6094: ARROW-7467: [Java] ComplexCopier does incorrect copy for Map nullable info
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/6094
 
 
   Related to [ARROW-7467](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-7467).
   
   The MapVector and its 'value' vector are nullable, and its structVector and 'key' vector are non-nullable.
   However, the MapVector generated by ComplexCopier has all nullable fields which is not correct.
 
----------------------------------------------------------------

tianchen92 commented on pull request #6094: ARROW-7467: [Java] ComplexCopier does incorrect copy for Map nullable info
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/6094#discussion_r365498809
 
 

 ##########
 File path: java/vector/src/main/codegen/templates/UnionMapWriter.java
 ##########
 @@ -98,6 +98,18 @@ public UnionMapWriter(MapVector vector) {
     entryWriter = struct();
   }
 
+  @Override
+  public void start() {
+    writer.setAddVectorAsNullable(false);
 
 Review comment:
   I think this is corresponding to MapVector’s null info, for example
   set false in start() means its inner struct vector is non-nullable(in normal usage, this should set in startEntry, but in ComplexCopier startEntry was not invoked)
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.

tianchen92 commented on pull request #6094: ARROW-7467: [Java] ComplexCopier does incorrect copy for Map nullable info
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/6094#discussion_r365498977
 
 

 ##########
 File path: java/vector/src/main/codegen/templates/ComplexCopier.java
 ##########
 @@ -63,6 +64,10 @@ private static void writeValue(FieldReader reader, FieldWriter writer) {
           writer.start();
           for(String name : reader){
             FieldReader childReader = reader.reader(name);
+            if (writer instanceof UnionMapWriter) {
 
 Review comment:
   Complex copier didn't call UnionMapWriter startEntry/key/value API(which call setAddVectorAsNullable), thus the nullable info was not set properly, we should set these infos from input FieldReader (key vector set non-nullable, value vector set nullable) 
 
----------------------------------------------------------------

BryanCutler commented on pull request #6094: ARROW-7467: [Java] ComplexCopier does incorrect copy for Map nullable info
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/6094#discussion_r373635446
 
 

 ##########
 File path: java/vector/src/main/codegen/templates/ComplexCopier.java
 ##########
 @@ -58,6 +59,27 @@ private static void writeValue(FieldReader reader, FieldWriter writer) {
           writer.endList();
         }
         break;
+      case MAP:
+        if (reader.isSet()) {
+          writer.startList();
 
 Review comment:
   Why not use the methods in `UnionMapWriter`
   ```
   startMap()
   startEntry()
   ...
   endEntry()
   endMap()
   ```
   
   Then you wouldn't need to use `setAddVectorAsNullable`

issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

fields.description:
The {{MapVector}} and its 'value' vector are nullable, and its {{structVector}} and 'key' vector are non-nullable.

However, the {{MapVector}} generated by ComplexCopier has all nullable fields which is not correct.
fields.summary: [Java] ComplexCopier does incorrect copy for Map nullable info
